channel.title: BUpolitics
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from BUpolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: California Illegal Aliens May Get to Push #1 for a Phone Subsidy
item.description: For years mass immigration advocates have rejected any meaningful distinction in status between illegal aliens and legal immigrants. As such, many sta...

item.title: Biden touts economic gains, acknowledges a long way to go
item.description: Interest rate cut "is not a declaration of victory, it’s a declaration of progress."

item.title: Google Files EU Antitrust Complaint Against Microsoft
item.description: The search giant argues that Microsoft is abusing its market power in enterprise software to push customers to use its cloud-computing service.

item.title: Trump rails against immigration in a state shaped by immigrants
item.description: In a post on Truth Social, he lauded the unique character of Pennsylvania — a character built through immigration.

item.title: Report Says Illegal Aliens Responsible for Up to 75% of Violent Crime Arrests in Midtown Manhattan
item.description: New York City is in the midst of a violent migrant crime wave. According to a recent report by the New York Post, illegal aliens account for up to 75 ...

item.title: Fed moves to protect weakening job market with bold rate cut
item.description: The move signals that the central bank is growing nervous about the declining labor market.

item.title: Meta Turns to Awkwafina, John Cena to Draw Users to AI
item.description: The tech company is expected to announce deals with celebrities who have agreed to allow a likeness of their voices to be used with its AI assistant.

item.title: Election 2024 live updates: Trump returning to North Carolina; Harris heading to Pennsylvania
item.description: Get the latest news from the 2024 campaign trail in the contest between Vice President Kamala Harris and former president Donald Trump.

item.title: DHS Inspector General Releases Report on CBP One App, Highlights Mismanagement
item.description: On August 19, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) Office of the Inspector General (OIG) released a report critiquing the CBP One mobile app. To ...

item.title: Joe Biden preps to sell the economy — to boost his legacy and help Harris
item.description: Biden is determined to convince a skeptical public that he strengthened the economy.

item.title: Big Tech Is Rushing to Find Clean Power to Fuel AI's Insatiable Appetite
item.description: Google and Microsoft are scrounging for geothermal and other green-power sources after emissions surge.

item.title: President Joe Biden is making an appearance on ABC’s “The View.”
Is Sweden Turning the Corner on Open Borders?
item.description: Sweden was once a poster child for open-borders advocates, and regularly made headlines for the social problems associated with those policies. Howeve...

item.title: Vance’s media strategy takes a turn
item.description: He was Trump’s policy whisperer to key voting blocs. Now, he’s fueling rumors that Haitian immigrants in Ohio are eating cats and dogs.

item.title: After Years of Warnings, Telegram Founder Cedes to Police Requests About Users
item.description: Following the arrest of founder Pavel Durov in France, the messaging and social-media app has reversed course and is regularly turning over phone numb...

item.title: Arizona official who certifies elections alleges fraud after his defeat
item.description: After losing a primary contest for sheriff, a Republican member of the Pinal County governing board accused his colleagues of rigging the election aga...

item.title: Bus Tickets to Brussels: Hungary Defies EU Open Borders Despotism
item.description: Earlier this summer the European Court of Justice (ECJ) fined Hungary €200 million for skirting an EU law mandating that refugees have a right to clai...

item.title: Weed, wages and same-sex marriage: The most intriguing ballot measures that voters will decide in November
item.description: Across the U.S. in November, voters will weigh proposals on election policies, minimum wage increases and marijuana legalization.

item.title: Is There a Safe Place to Complain About Work Online?
item.description: No, deleting your incriminating chats won’t protect you.
